Generate node positions for a neighborhood glyph

Source: R/cellNeighborhoodGlyph.R
generateNodePosition.Rd

Compute node-level (x, y) positions for placing nodes relative to region-specific arcs in a cell neighborhood glyph.

Usage

generateNodePosition(
  node_data,
  arc_center,
  node_scale = list(c(0.4, 0.4), c(0.4, 0.4)),
  node_xjust = c(0, 0),
  node_yjust = c(2.5, -0.4)
)

Arguments

node_data

A data.frame containing node-level information, produced by generateNodeData().

arc_center

A numeric vector of length 2 specifying the (x, y) center of the glyph.

node_scale

A list of numeric vectors of length 2 specifying x- and y-axis scaling factors for node placement. Each element in the list corresponds to one region. Default is list(c(0.4, 0.4), c(0.4, 0.4)).

node_xjust

A numeric vector specifying horizontal justification offsets applied to node positions. Each value corresponds to one region. Default is c(0, 0).

node_yjust

A numeric vector specifying vertical justification offsets applied to node positions. Each value corresponds to one region. Default is c(2.5, -0.4).

Value

A data.frame containing node coordinates and associated node attributes.
